channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Three officers shot and wounded in Texas after gunman opens fire and barricades himself in a home
item.description: Three police officers were shot and injured on Sunday after being called to a home in Cedar Parks, near Austin, Texas. The gunman is barricaded inside a home and the incident is ongoing.

item.title: Ronnie O'Sullivan clinches sixth title after defeating Kyren Wilson in the World Championship final
item.description: Only Stephen Hendry's seven crowns now stand between the 44-year-old and undisputed acclaim as the greatest player in the modern sport after he wrecked Wilson's hopes of a final debut win.

item.title: Parents of British backpacker who was murdered in Thailand thank nation's king
item.description: Zaw Lin and Win Zaw Tun were found guilty of the rape and murder of Hannah Witheridge, 23, and of killing David Miller, 24 in September 2014.

item.title: Arthur Chatto has finished his charity effort and raised £21,059 by rowing 2,000 miles around the UK
item.description: The grandson of the Queen's sister, Chatto, 20, has finished his UK charity rowing tour which began on July 8th. The student was greeted by loved ones including girlfriend Lizzie at St Katherine's Dock.

item.title: After the heartache of her baby son's death, Charlie Gard's mother is full of joy for her newborn
item.description: Connie Yates and Chris Gard feared they might never have another chance to be parents. But on August 5 they welcome little Ollie into the world at Queen Charlotte's and Chelsea hospital, London.

item.title: Fears grow that Croatia will be added to 'red list' but airport test could be game-changer
item.description: Ministers are being urged to replace the disastrous 14-day quarantine system with a 'game-changer' virus test at airports, before more countries are put on the red list.

item.title: Huge job losses on horizon if Debenhams bosses take 'last resort' liquidation option
item.description: Plans are being drawn up to liquidate Debenhams - along with its 14,000 jobs - if other options for saving the company fall through. This would make it the biggest victim of the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: Algorithms can cause real harm... said head of Ofqual
item.description: Roger Taylor, head of Ofqual, led a study last year which warned algorithms could cause 'real harm' when they are making 'important decisions about people's lives'.

item.title: McDonald's boss bites back in war over £30m payoff deal
item.description: Steve Easterbrook, who was sacked last year over a relationship with a junior colleague, has accused his former bosses of presiding over a shoddy investigation.

item.title: The Crown: Elizabeth Debicki to play Princess Diana for final two series of hit Netflix show
item.description: The Night Manager star Elizabeth Debicki has been cast as Princess Diana for the final two seasons of The Crown.

item.title: Blue Planet's creators 'made millions from adverts for plastic bottles that clog up oceans'
item.description: Alastair Fothergill made a fortune promoting adverts for China's biggest bottled water manufacturer - Nongfu Springs - which sells 15billion bottles every year.

item.title: Police are pelted with missiles as they try to break up lockdown-breaching rave
item.description: Hundreds of revellers were caught flouting social distancing guidelines as they attended an illegal lockdown party inside a gazebo in Gorton, Manchester.

item.title: Face to face with the vile savages who killed my husband
item.description: HELEN CARROLL: There is no guidance, no handbook. For six months, Lissie Harper wondered how she would feel, seeing the teenagers who'd robbed her of her husband Andrew.

item.title: Film-maker accuses street cat Bob owner of 'appeal con' after he sets up crowdfunding page for £250k
item.description: Street cat Bob owner James Bowen, 41, is raising funds for a £250k memorial to the cat who died in June. Film-maker has privately accused him of 'fraudulent' fund-raising saying it rang 'alarm bells'.

item.title: Will GCSE results be delayed? As exam fiasco plumbs new depths, top Tories call for postponement
item.description: Lord Baker, who introduced the GCSE system, said this Thursday's results announcement should be delayed by two weeks to allow the grades to be revised.

item.title: Wheelchair user, 17, is told he is 'not disabled enough' to compete for Britain's Paralympic team
item.description: Oscar Knight, 17, plays for the Plymouth Raiders, and was selected to be a part of the GB Academy. He even captained an under-22 team in a recent game against Spain.

item.title: IAN BOTHAM on his wild times on and off the pitch
item.description: Sir IAN BOTHAM, 64, reminisces about the 'comradeship' of those wild, months-long overseas tours and how, finally, he has found his calm place as a doting grandad.

item.title: Woman in her 40s is arrested for murder after boy, 10, was found dead at house in west London
item.description: A woman, in her 40s, has been arrested on suspicion of murder after officers and the London Ambulance Service attended a home in Acton , west London and found the dead 10-year-old boy.

item.title: She survived Auschwitz, now 92, Dr EDITH EGER says . . . Learn to love your life
item.description: Dr Edith Eger, 92, a clinical psychologist and Auschwitz survivor reveals how you can take control of your own thoughts by breaking free from busy-ness and replacing 'I can't' with 'i'm trying'.

item.title: JANE FRYER takes a ghost ship tour - a new tourist attraction off the South Coast
item.description: As the £10billion cruise industry struggles to stay afloat, JANE FRYER visits an unlikely new tourist attraction off the south coast, as fans hop in small boats to take a tour of the ships abandoned at sea

item.title: Fantasy fans can now stay in Bilbo Baggin's 'Hobbit house' in New York for $500 a night
item.description: Fans of the J.R.R. Tolkein's fantansy series The Hobbit can now rent a home inspired by Bilbo Baggins' home in Pawling, New York. The listing was placed on Airbnb for $500 a night.

item.title: As row with France over Channel crossings rages, SUE REID speaks to refugees in Calais
item.description: SUE REID: La Rotonde is a beachgoers' paradise. But at dusk it becomes a hot spot for people traffickers who push migrants out to sea in flimsy vessels - and charge exorbitant prices.

item.title: Moment white man is knocked out after racist rant telling black passengers they're 'all going back'
item.description: Footage posted online shows a white man in a heated confrontation with other passengers as the Central Line train pulls into Bank station in Central London this afternoon.

item.title: Four young men die in horror smash after car ploughs into house on the A4 in Wiltshire
item.description: Four young men have died after a car crashed into a house on the A4 in Wiltshire during the early hours of Sunday, police have said.

item.title: As flats take over, HANNAH BETTS says... It will take more than Covid to part me from my heels!
item.description: Kate Moss is in ballet pumps, Alexa Chung actual ballet shoes, while Stormzy wore his slippers on breakfast TV. HANNAH BETTS reveals why she will not be settling for a flat shoe due to covid-19.

item.title: The REAL reason French women don't get fat: Nutritionist JANE CLARKE reveals
item.description: Nutritionist Jane Clarke reveals how the French women do it. How you can look chic whilst still enjoying your favourite foods and ignoring portion control. The key is enjoyment, says Jane.

item.title: Home Office apology after Channel migrants sent to Priti Patel's Essex constituency
item.description: Bosses at the Home Office say they have launched a 'full review' into their operation of finding temporary accommodation for asylum seekers who arrive in the UK without a home to go to.

item.title: For recovering alcoholic Tanya Gold, stripped of AA during lockdown, it was a battle to stay sober
item.description: Journalist Tanya Gold reveals the struggles she faced during lockdown in Cornwall after the closure of her usual support group AA left her struggling with her 'monster' after 20 years of sobriety.

item.title: Ellen DeGeneres talk show guest claims host's kind on-screen demeanor is 'all an act'
item.description: Dana Dimatteo appeared on the show in 2018 after flying from Chicago to Los Angeles to attend a taping - a prospect the 29-year-old had been incredibly excited about.

item.title: Amazon creating 1,000 jobs at UK warehouse
item.description: It began building a 1.75m sq ft distribution centre near Sutton-in-Ashfield last year. It is now taking on engineers and other employees for the site, which is the size of 22 football pitches.

item.title: PICTURE EXCLUSIVE: Louise Redknapp steps out in Ibiza after 'ex Jamie's new girlfriend is revealed'
item.description: The former Eternal singer, 45, put on a casual display as she stepped out in Ibiza on Friday evening alongside her two sons Charley, 16, and Beau, 11, as well as a large group of friends.

item.title: Rescheduled 2021 Tokyo Olympics will NOT take place unless a vaccine is found
item.description: Japanese vaccine researcher Yoshiharu Matsuura told Sky News the 'only way' for the Olympics to take place would be through the development of an effective vaccine.

item.title: 'Suburban housewives' mobilize against Trump on Facebook after president promised to win their vote
item.description: Several Facebook groups have cropped up with women vowing to stop Trump from winning a second term days after the president declared: 'The "suburban housewife" will be voting for me.'

item.title: Coastguard calls off search for brothers, 16 and 18, who vanished off Lancashire coast
item.description: Two bodies have been found in the search for missing teenage brothers, Muhammad Azhar Shabbir, 18, and Ali Athar Shabbir, 16, who vanished off the Lancashire coast yesterday.

item.title: Flash flooding damages buildings and shuts roads across southeast England
item.description: The M11 northbound was forced to close between Junction 7 and Stansted Airport after heavy rainfall caused water to gush onto the major highway. The Met Office is warning of further downpours.

item.title: Russian schoolgirl, 13, who claimed boy, 10, was her unborn baby's father gives birth to daughter
item.description: Darya Sudnishnikova, 13, who claimed that her boyfriend, 10, had impregnated her, has now given birth at a clinic in Krasnoyarsk, Siberia, after a 'tough' delivery.

item.title: George Osborne misses out on top job at Royal Opera House as board names Carphone Warehouse founder
item.description: George Osborne missed out on a position as chairman of the Royal Opera House after a nominations committee selected the co-founder of Carphone Warehouse David Ross.

item.title: Deborah James, 38, said she thought she would not make it to 40
item.description: Podcaster Deborah James, 38, pictured, also known as the Bowel Babe, told the Sunday Express she can't think about her milestone birthday in 2021 as she was told she'd never reach it.

item.title: Keir Starmer set to nominate Tom Watson for peerage after first bid was blocked earlier this year
item.description: Labour leader Keir Starmer is expected to put forward Mr Watson in a list of peerages being prepared by Boris Johnson after an earlier nomination by Jeremy Corbyn was blocked

item.title: Kim Kardashian and Kanye West go 'glamping' with their children in Colorado
item.description: Kim Kardashian, 39, and Kanye West, 43, have been focusing on family time in the hopes of salvaging their crumbling marriage.

item.title: Russell Brand slammed after he discussed whether Cardi B and Megan Thee Stallion's song WAP is porn
item.description: The comedian, 45, shared a video of himself discussing the hit song and whether it was a 'feminist masterpiece or porn'.

item.title: Adele credits a life-changing self-help book for her seven-stone weight loss
item.description: The popstar, 32, said in a post on Instagram on Saturday that reading Untamed, Stop Pleasing, Start Living by Glennon Doyle proved life-changing.

item.title: Israel launches airstrikes at Hamas targets in Gaza
item.description: The measures came after a week of heightened tensions, including clashes on Saturday evening along the Gaza-Israeli border, the army said.

item.title: Two police forces slammed after refusing job applications to candidates with 'gender critical' views
item.description: A woman who enquired about a role at Norfolk Constabulary and at another force in the southeast was told the jobs would not be suitable for her because of her 'gender critical' views.

item.title: Joe Biden sends condolences to President Trump after death of younger brother Robert
item.description: Joe Biden said in a tweet that he and wife Jill were 'sad' to learn of Robert Trump's passing, whose death was emotionally announced by the president on Saturday evening.

item.title: UK students descend on Westminster for day three of angry protests
item.description: Hundreds of young demonstrators in Parliament Square lofted banners and placards with pictures of Gavin Williamson on them, calling for the education secretary to be sacked.

item.title: Couples opt for intimate ceremonies as lockdown rules eased with receptions of 30 guests now allowed
item.description: Sit-down receptions, which have been off the cards since the start of the pandemic, are to be allowed in England from August 15 with up to 30 guests allowed to attend receptions.

item.title: Pupils CAN now use teachers' predicted grades to challenge GCSE and A-Levels results
item.description: The Office for Qualifications and Examinations Regulation last night revealed the major U-turn after a furious backlash from pupils after marks were downgraded.

item.title: Shocking moment man riding electric scooter jumps red light at busy junction
item.description: A driving instructor shared the video of the man running a red light, and weaving in between oncoming traffic on London Road in Mitcham in the London Borough of Merton.

item.title: Valentino Rossi avoid horror crash in Austrian MotoGP
item.description: Terrifying scenes unfolded at the Austrian MotoGP, after a collision between and Franco Morbidelli and Johann Zarco saw two unmanned motor cycles tossed through their air at high speed.

item.title: London policewoman is stabbed in the face with a PEN in 'vicious and unprovoked attack'
item.description: The Metropolitan Police said the woman was taken to hospital with injuries that are not life-threatening after the assault in Edgware, north London, today.

item.title: Scottish ministers face more bullying complaints than every other UK department COMBINED
item.description: The findings come ahead of a Scottish parliament inquiry this week which will hear evidence on how complaints about former first minister Alex Salmond were handled.

item.title: Tens of thousands of protesters stage 'March for Freedom' in Minsk
item.description: Chanting 'Leave!', the protesters marched down Independence Avenue following an opposition call for the biggest rally yet in a week of demonstrations since the vote.

item.title: England rugby star Courtney Lawes urges parents to get married to create a 'stable family'
item.description: Courtney Lawes, 31, called on the Government to incentivise marriage as unmarried couples are four times more likely to split. He said: 'a stable family means one where parents are married.'

item.title: NHS chief slams ministers for trying to shift the blame for coronavirus failings onto health bosses
item.description: The Covid-19 response work of Public Health England is to be merged with NHS Test and Trace to form a new body designed to deal with pandemics. Pictured: NHS Providers' Chris Hopson.

item.title: UK records four more coronavirus deaths - taking total to 41,365, preliminary figures show
item.description: The 1,040 figure is only 22 cases smaller than the 1,062 reported last Sunday - which came almost a fortnight after Boris Johnson predicted a second wave in two weeks.

item.title: Mother of Britain's largest family Sue Radford reveals her tattoo tribute to her stillborn son Alfie
item.description: Sue, 44, and husband Noel Radford, 48, from Lancashire, who welcomed their first child 30 years ago, shared a picture of Sue's tattoo tribute to their son Alife who was stillborn in 2014.

item.title: Scottish Tory leader Douglas Ross apologises to veterans after missing a VJ Day commemoration
item.description: Scottish Conservative leader Douglas Ross said he was 'wrong' to have rejected an invitation to mark 75 years since the end of the Second World War in his Moray constituency.

item.title: Gardener breaks new speed record in a motorised wheelbarrow during lockdown
item.description: Kevin Nicks, from Oxfordshire, set himself a challenge to motorise a wheelbarrow on zero budget while he was in lockdown in Chipping Norton. He recently set the world record with it.

item.title: Border Force intercepts at least 15 more migrants off Kent coast today
item.description: At least 15 refugees including a baby were picked up off the Kent coast this morning by Border Force officials. It follows more than 1,000 arrivals in last 10 days.

item.title: Police launch murder probe after good Samaritan, 24, is beaten to death trying to break up fight
item.description: A 24-year-old man suffered fatal head injuries as he was trying to break up the brawl outside The Clifton Wetherspoons pub in the town of Sedgley, near Dudley, West Midlands.

item.title: Russian oligarch's estranged wife slams Prince Harry and Meghan Markle for 'double standards'
item.description: Anna Fedoseeva, who is involved in a bitter court battle with the billionaire Russian ex-bank boss Sergey Grishin (pictured together) , claims he is a 'dangerous man' who destroyed her life.

item.title: Sex expert warns against policing what your partner does
item.description: Australia-based sex expert Nadia Bokody, who is best known for sharing her sex addiction, revealed to News.com.au how dictating what your partner does can be the downfall of a relationship.

item.title: Supermodel Karen Elson feared saying no to nude shoots at just 16 would kill her career
item.description: Karen Elson 41, speaks about her experiences in the fashion industry and the difficulties she faced with body image after setbacks in her 25-year career.

item.title: Thousands more people may die of cancer after urgent hospital referrals plunged by 250,000
item.description: GPs made 339,242 urgent referrals for people with cancer symptoms between April and June in England, more than 250,000 fewer than the 594,060 figure reported in the same months in 2019.

item.title: Telephone service begins between UAE and Israel as ties...
item.description: On Sunday, telephone service between the United Arab Emirates and Israel opened up as the two the countries work towards full diplomatic ties. The 'peace deal' was announced on Thursday.
item.media:description: FILE - In this Thursday, Aug. 13, 2020 file photo, the Tel Aviv City Hall is lit up with the flag of the United Arab Emirates as the UAE and Israel announced they would be establishing full diplomatic ties, in Tel Aviv, Israel. On Sunday, Aug. 16, 2020, telephone service between the UAE and Israel began as the two countries opened diplomatic ties. (AP Photo/Oded Balilty, File)

item.title: Foodies divided as recipe suggests grilling WHOLE sunflower head and eating it like corn on the cob
item.description: Foodlovers have been debating whether they would try out a recipe from Baker Creek Heirloom Seed Company in Mansfield, Missouri, which suggests eating a whole grilled sunflower head.

item.title: Jaw-dropping winners at the 2020 bird photographer of the year awards
item.description: The judging team said that most of the 15,000 images entered into the competition are 'of an amazing standard, sufficient eye-candy to feed even the most visually gluttonous'.

item.title: Protests turn into battles as rallies across the US turn ugly
item.description: Protests across the US calling for an end to police brutality were held on Saturday - some descending into tense stand-offs. In Chicago rioters hit police, and shots were fired in Portland.

item.title: Dietitian reveals the foods you should consume regularly to instantly boost your mood
item.description: Sydney-based dietitian Susie Burrell has outlined the five types of foods that will boost your mood instantly - including nuts, bananas, wholegrain sourdough, salmon and vegetables.

item.title: Mother whose eczema was so bad she was turned down for jobs healed herself naturally with vegan diet
item.description: Mother-of-two Misty Rowe-Elliot, 42, from Doncaster says she was often 'the best dancer in the room' but would get rejected from auditions because of her eczema.

item.title: Terrifying British Zoom-based horror film Host takes the internet by storm
item.description: Host is about a group of people who try to contact spirits during a call on video conferencing platform Zoom. - with the expert help of a medium who loses her internet connection.

item.title: Hero PC Andrew Harper's mother urges Anne Sacoolas to return to the UK to face justice
item.description: Debbie Adlam,said she wrote the letter to Anne Sacoolas the day after the anniversary of her own son's death because 'there is too much suffering going on to sit and do nothing'.

item.title: Husband who punched shark in the eye as it mauled his wife relives the moment it latched onto her
item.description: Chantelle Doyle, 35, was surfing with her husband Mark Rapley at Shelly Beach in Port Macquarie, on the New South Wales mid-north coast, when she was attacked about 9.30am on Saturday.

item.title: Tory MP arrested on suspicion of raping HoC researcher can return to Parliament in two weeks' time
item.description: The politician will be questioned again as the police continues its probe. Scotland Yard confirmed last night it is being carried out by the Met Central Specialist Crime , Complex Case Team.

item.title: Poet Kate Tempest comes out as non-binary and reveals they have changed their name to Kae
item.description: Poet Kate Tempest has revealed they have changed their name to Kae Tempest and come out as non-binary after 'struggling to accept themselves for a long time' in a Twitter statement.

item.title: Cast behind new horror film made entirely on Zoom reveal the tricks that make it so realistic
item.description: Horror film Host sees a group of six friends hold a seance on a Zoom call which soon goes horribly wrong. Actresses Caroline Ward and Emma Louise Webb have revealed the secrets behind filming.

item.title: Furious students and parents launch legal battle against exams watchdog Ofqual
item.description: Among those taking legal action are Hamza Nur, whose son dropped marks, six pupils supported by the Good Law Project, Curtis Parfitt-Ford, and Michael Bell and daughter Lexi (pictured).

item.title: Green roads revolution 'will risk lives', paramedics warn
item.description: New one-way systems, road closures and bicycle lanes could put lives at risk as ambulances struggle to reach those in need of help, the College of Paramedics said.

item.title: Chefs reveal the one piece of equipment they couldn't live without
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Femail chats to eight of the UK's top chefs about kitchen gadgets they consider 'must-haves' when creating gourmet meals - including decent knives and a top class blender.

item.title: Aerial photos show stricken Japanese cargo ship ripped to pieces on reef off Mauritius
item.description: A Japanese bulk carrier that ran aground on a reef in Mauritius last month threatening a marine ecological disaster around the Indian Ocean island has broken apart, authorities have confirmed.

item.title: Hodgkin's lymphoma: Samantha Benson, 33, reveals early signs of 'silent killer' blood cancer
item.description: At 31, Sydney marketing director Samantha Benson was the 'healthiest she had ever been', 'hardly drinking' and training CrossFit four times a week. Until her left collarbone started to swell.

item.title: Senior police officer who faced abuse about her hairstyle named chief constable
item.description: Rachel Swann was mocked by cruel TV viewers who threw jibes at her spiked, dyed hairstyle on social media while she was at the centre of the Whaley Bridge evacuation last year.

item.title: Infuriating optical illusion leaves the internet baffled
item.description: US educational site Optics4Kids, shared a baffling optical illusion that has gone viral on the internet. They explained how the colourful graphic uses tricky patterns to deceive the eyes.

item.title: Police issue warning over dangerously strong 'Donald Trump' shaped ecstasy pills
item.description: A man in his 30s from Luton has been arrested on suspicion of supplying the high-strength orange tablets, which have been made to look like the US president's head, said Bedfordshire Police.

item.title: PC Andrew Harper's mother talks of his legacy on anniversary
item.description: Pc Harper's family and Thames Valley Police officers gathered on Friday for services and a minute of silence. His mother Debbie Adlam attended a memorial in Berkshire, to mark the anniversary

item.title: PC Andrew Harper murder: MP calls for 20 years' jail for killers
item.description: Conservative MP John Howell met Debbie Adlam on Monday to discuss the family's campaign for 'Andrew's Law', calling for those who kill police officers to face a minimum of 20 years in prison.

item.title: Government plans to end automatic one-third reduction for guilty pleas
item.description: Justice Secretary Robert Buckland is reportedly studying proposals to end the current practice of reducing jail sentences by one third.
